bioghist.p: The Chemical Bond Approach (CBA) Project was a new approach for teaching chemistry to secondary students that was first developed in 1959. It emphasized grounding in the theoretical concepts of chemistry rather than simple memorization. Its development came in response to the United States' fear of being eclipsed in the sciences after the launch of Sputnik.

scopecontent.p: This collection of materials was donated by H. Anthony Neidig, one of the four directors of the CBA project (1959-1963). The collection consists of trial editions of CBA textbooks and records of the testing of the programs. Materials include: student and teacher versions of textbooks and laboratory manuals; reference articles; documentation of an Educational Testing Service (ETS) evaluation of the CBA materials; records of feedback received from teachers who tested the program; correspondence and other records from the 1961 CBA Summer Institute in Santiago, Chile; reprints of articles about the CBA program; CBA newsletters; information about the Reed College Conference on High School Chemistry, and miscellaneous records relating to the project.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
